roleset.name: bend at waist (or neck), possibly in deference
roleset.note: BOW-V NOTES: The metaphorical usage could be referred to as "defer to". Corresponds to VN classes acquiesce-95, curtsey-40.3.3. (from bow.01-v)
BOW-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01. Comparison to verb entry bow.01, which maps to VN classes 40.3.3 and 95; no relevant FN entry. (from bow.01-n)

example.name: bow-v: made up
example.text: John bowed to the King of Spain.

example.name: bow-v: metaphorical
example.text: John bowed to the superior experience of his mother.
example.arg: to the superior experience of his mother

example.name: bow-v
example.text: Then he bowed his head and died .

example.name: bow-n: All arguments
example.text: First, Obama's a tall man...of course his bow to a relatively very short man is bound to be somewhat awkward.
example.arg: to a relatively very short man

roleset.name: bend, bending as a spatial configuration
roleset.note: BOW-V NOTES: This seems to the same roleset, and is closely related, but the word is pronounced differently--[boh] rather than [bau]. (from bow.02-v)
BOW-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bow.02, which maps to VN classes 47.3, 47.6, 50. (from bow.02-n)

example.name: bend
example.text: I saw a steel beam bow six feet from where I was sitting.
example.arg: six feet from where I was sitting

roleset.name: fail
roleset.note: BOW-V NOTES: This sentence makes no sense to me. No corresponding VN class. (from bow.03-v)

example.text: Eighteen months ago a disposable seven-day model bowed.

roleset.name: bend at waist, more emphatically
roleset.note: BOW_DOWN-V NOTES: No corresponding VN class for verb particle construction. (from bow.04-v)

example.name: worship
example.text: The Bible forbids [us]-1 *trace*-1 to bow down to graven images.

roleset.name: exit, leave
roleset.note: BOW_OUT-V NOTES: Corresponds to VN class Withdraw-82-1. (from bow.06-v)

example.name: not a physical place left
example.text: New England Electric bowed out of the bidding for Public Service of New Hampshire.
example.arg: of the bidding for Public Service of New Hampshire.
